intro: Sopubia graminicola, commonly known as the grassland spurge, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant has erect, hairy stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Sopubia graminicola is known for its ability to tolerate drought and is often found in disturbed or semi-arid environments.
